page.title: 01 General Introduction
page.content: This pleasant rural area,to the west of Northampton, is mainly one of arable farms. The clay soil supports crops of wheat,barley, oats and oil-seed rape which paints the countryside bright yellow in spring. The production of the latter is on the increase. To the south, around Harpole, where the land is a little wetter, there is more emphasis on animal production. The block contains, in the north, part of the village of Upper Harlestone & to the south a very small portion of the village of Harpole. To the east is the busy residential area of New Duston on the western outskirts of Northampton. The area is dissected by a Roman Rd. as Duston was a Romano-British settlement. Most people are employed in some form of agriculture e.g. farming, garden centres, nurseries or forestry; or travel to work in Northampton.
